titleInfo.title: McKinley High School Oral History Project: Baton Rouge Bus Boycott
titleInfo.subTitle: Patricia Ann Robinson oral history interview, 1998

name.description: Patricia Ann Robinson was born in 1957 to James and Ella May Robinson. She grew up in South Baton Rouge where she attended McKinley Junior and Senior High School. She went on to major in Business at Southern University. At the time of this interview, she was Director of Special Projects with the Louisiana Department of Economic Development.

mods.abstract: Robinson discusses her experiences with riding the bus in Baton Rouge in the 1960s and 70s and her knowledge of the bus system in the area. She shares what she learned from her parents and other older community members about the Baton Rouge Bus Boycott of 1953. She discusses her experiences as a McKinley student and recounts discrimination she has faced and how she handled it.
